body:
Here is a glossary of all the terms and definitions you need to know while using the HackerRank for Work platform.

Term Definition
Recruiter  A type of license that is assigned to users who can create and edit tests, questions, and reports and send invites to candidates. Users with recruiter licenses who are a part of the enterprise plan can also use HackerRank Interview to create and conduct interviews.

Click here to learn more.
Interviewer  A license type is given to users who can create questions in the library and take technical interviews using HackerRank Interviews.

Click here to learn more. 
Developer A license type is given to users who can create questions and interviews and access candidates. A developer license is usually assigned to a software developer or technical manager within the company.

Click here to learn more.
Team Admin  This is a type of user who has complete access to manage other users within their team,
add or remove users and change the permissions of existing users. A team admin usually has a recruiter or developer license.

Click here to learn more. 
Company Admin  This type of user has complete access to manage all the teams within the company, including all tests, questions, and interviews, as well as modifying company-level settings. A company admin usually has a recruiter or developer license.

Click here to learn more.
Roles  Job positions in any company for which candidates are hired. At HackerRank, it is a collection of different skills that match the skills required for a particular job opening.

Click here to learn more.
Skills  A Skill is the knowledge of a technical topic or an ability to perform a technical task that can be assessed in a given period of time.

Click here to learn more.

 

Term Section Definition
 Test General  Online assessments available on the HackerRank platform that companies use to assess candidates for various roles. Tests were formerly known as CodeScreen. 
Active Tests General  Tests that are in the published state can be used to send invites to candidates.
Archived Test  General  Tests that are not in use can be archived. Archiving a test removes it from the active test list without deleting it.
You can restore a test that is archived and use it in your hiring process.
Click here to learn more. 
Starred Tests  General  You can use this feature to make a particular test appear at the top of your tests tab. This will help you find important tests quickly. 
Test Sections General Logical categories within a test are used to group questions of similar type or that can test a candidate on a particular concept.

Click here to learn more.
Locked Test General Tests in this status are not editable by anyone within the company. Test owners or company admins can lock a test to prevent anyone from making any changes to its questions and settings.

Click here to learn more.
Try Test General A feature within the test that allows the Recruiters to perform a trial run of their tests before inviting candidates. During the trial, you can validate each test question by submitting the answer and viewing the results.

Click here to learn more.
Share Test General A feature within a test that allows test owners to share the test with other teams or users within their organization. Test owners can control the level of access that other teams or users can have to the test.

Click here to learn more.
Clone Test General A feature that allows you to create a copy of a test. The cloned test will have the same questions and settings as the original one. You can, however, modify the same later.

Click here to learn more.
Draft Test General Any test that is not published is in Draft status. Test owners cannot invite candidates to a test that is in draft status.

Click here to learn more.
Cutoff Score Test Settings A score is set to tests that are used to filter out unqualified candidates from the test. All candidates with scores greater than the cutoff score will automatically be marked qualified.
Test Instructions Test Settings A set of guidelines that can be set at the time of test creation for candidates to follow while attempting the test.
Public Test Test Settings Tests can be accessed by anyone who has the URL to the test.
Click here to learn more
Private URL Test Settings Tests that are password protected can be accessed by individuals who have the correct password to the test.
Creating these tests is useful when you want to have control over who can access the test.

Click here to learn more.

Test Expiration Time Test Settings The time frame is marked by the start login date/time and end login date/time for the test. The test URL remains active within this time frame and candidates will only be able to attempt between the start and end time for the test.

Click here to learn more.
Proctoring Test Settings The feature enables the hiring company to monitor a candidate's focus on the test screen while they are attempting the test. Using this feature, recruiters can assess their candidate's authenticity and note any suspicious activities or malpractices during the test.

Click here to learn more.
Confirmation Email Test Settings Enabling this setting will send an email to the candidates after they complete a test.

Click here to learn more.
Reminder Email Test Settings Enabling this setting will send a reminder to candidates before a test. Only one reminder is sent to each candidate.

Click here to learn more.
Email Template Test Settings A sample test invitation format that already has some detail in place and can be edited further to meet the requirement of the test. Recruiters can save different email invite formats in the form of email templates, reuse them later and share the same with others within their team. 
Admin Email Test Settings A field in the Test Settings where you can put email addresses of individuals who should receive candidate reports for the test. These individuals are other than the test owner or recruiter who invites the candidate.
Test Summary report Test Report A short overview of the report of a candidate who is invited to a test. The test summary page contains the current test status (e.g., "test completed-evaluation required, test completed-qualified, etc.), candidate's detail, their score for each question that is present in the test, etc.

Click here to learn more.
Detailed Report Test Report A detailed test report explaining a candidate's performance in a test. The Test Reports are generated after the Candidates' have submitted a Test, and their answers are evaluated and assigned scores if applicable.

Click here to learn more.
Timeline Test Report This tab under the candidate report will have the complete details about the candidate's actions by time from start to end of a test.
Plagiarism Flag Test Report A flag that denotes if a candidate's code submission has similarities with other codes available on the internet.
We recommend that the hiring manager or engineer should review the highlighted code to make a decision if this is an actual case of malpractice or not.

Click here to learn more.
Test Insight Test Insights Datapoints that provide a complete statistical analysis of the progress of a test. The test insights help recruiters analyze the trend of their candidates’ performance in comparison with the time taken and scores achieved by them in a particular Test.


Click here to learn more.
Distribution of Candidate Score Test Insights A graph representing the different range of scores achieved by candidates who have submitted the test. You can use this score graph to understand an approximate number or percentage of candidates who are successful with the Test and can be potentially hired.

Click here to learn more.
Median Attempt Time Test Insights Indicates the median value from different candidates’ test completion times. This median value serves as a benchmark correlation to separate the faster and slower test takers.

Click here to learn more.
Median time To Full Score Test Insights Indicates the median value from different test completion times. It considers only those tests in which candidates have achieved a full score. This median value serves as a benchmark correlation to separate test takers who achieved a full score in the shortest possible time.

Click here to learn more.
Median Time Test Insights For every question in the Test, this graph represents the median value of the time taken to solve a question.
Click here to learn more.
Median Score Test Insights For every question in the test, this graph represents the median value of the scores achieved.


Click here to learn more.
Candidate Status Test Insights A pie chart that represents the distribution of candidates who have passed or failed in the test and those who are yet to be evaluated for the test.
Test Health Dashboard Test Health A dashboard that offers an up-to-date view of the health of the test. It consists of a set of metrics that assist you in taking immediate steps in enhancing the quality of your hiring process.

Click here to learn more.
Candidate Response Test Health The measure of the number of candidates who start the test to the number of invites delivered to the candidates.

Click here to learn more.
Invite Email Delivery Rate Test Health The percentage of candidates who received their invites in the inbox, without it bouncing or getting marked as spam.

Click here to learn more.
Invite Email Open Rate Test Health The percentage of candidates who received your invites and opened them, as opposed to ignoring them or deleting them.

Click here to learn more.
Test Link Click Rate Test Health The percentage of candidates who clicked the link to take your test after opening the invite email.

Click here to learn more.
Test Start Rate Test Health The percentage of candidates who clicked on the invite link to take the test has gone through the steps and actually started the test.

Click here to learn more.
Assessment Quality Test Health You can find out how well your tests are helping in evaluating the candidates' strengths and weaknesses with the help of Assessment Quality. It is based on a variety of inputs, from the design of the tests to candidates' experience in taking them.

Click here to learn more.
Attempt Duration Distribution Test Health Determines whether your test's length is well-calibrated - not too long, not too short.

Click here to learn more.
Attempt Rate Test Health The metric to know how many candidates started the test and submitted an answer to at least one question. It measures the initial impression your test gives the candidates when they first see it.

Click here to learn more.
Completion Rate Test Health The metric is to know how many candidates are willing to see it through to the end, submitting an answer to every question on the test. A high completion rate means your test is well-calibrated to your candidates' abilities. A low completion rate means your candidates got stuck or frustrated midway through the test-taking process.

Click here to learn more.
Candidate Feedback Test Health The measure of overall candidate experience of your test. It gives the average rating across all candidates who chose to provide the feedback.

Click here to learn more.
Score Distribution Test Health A bell curve of the U-shaped curve metric is based on the distribution of scores candidates receive on tests. Tests with a wide score spread that are not too easy or too hard are more likely to lead to a most positive hiring outcome.

Click here to learn more.

Term Definition
Interview

Real-time pair programming environment to support remote technical interviews ranging from simple coding challenges to full-stack development scenarios. The interview was formerly known as CodePair.

Click here to learn more.

My Pads A list of all the interviews created by you.
HackerRank Lobby

A virtual waiting room for the candidate and the interviewers participating in an interview. When multiple interviewers are accessing a single Interview, the candidate or interviewer can wait in the HackerRank Lobby until they are permitted inside the interview.

Click here to learn more.

Whiteboard

A virtual tool that lets candidates and interviewers sketch diagrams using easy tools from the toolbar. When you end the interview, the sketches present on the whiteboard get captured and are available in the candidate’s report.

Click here to learn more.

Scorecard A private scorecard to manually evaluate the skills of the candidate during an interview. It displays a set of skills to be analyzed based on the role that the candidate is getting hired for. Click here to learn more.
Recommended Questions
 		A set of interview questions, curated specifically for interviews that take less than 30 mins to solve and are designed to have a quick read time. It comes with a set of interviewer's guidelines that provide hints, solution code, complexity analysis, potential follow-up questions, etc.
Click here to learn more.
Interview Templates
 		A structured set of questions to assist you in asking similar questions to every candidate applying for a particular role. Interview templates will reduce bias while also providing a way to benchmark and compare candidates to get the right fit.

Click here to learn more.
Leave Interview
 		A button inside the Interview allows interviewers to leave the interview without disturbing others. This feature is particularly helpful when multiple interviewers are present in the same interview at the same time.

Click here to learn more.
End Interview
A button inside the Interview that ends the session for all the participants present in the interview.

Click here to learn more.

Term Definition
Badges Candidates can participate in various challenges in HackerRank. Upon completing those challenges, they will be awarded Badges.

Click here to learn more.
Benchmarking Measure to compare candidate’s scores on specific skills against a cohort of candidates who have been assessed on the same set of skills.

Click here to learn more.
Candidate Individuals who attempt or are invited to attempt tests or interviews on the HackerRank platform
Candidate Packet One-stop solution for a candidate’s skills summary inside HackerRank. It hosts a collection of reports and scorecards of all the tests and interviews that a candidate has taken part in, for a particular role.

Click here to learn more.
Contest History The history of all the contests in the HackerRank Community (HRC) in which the candidate participated in the past.
Public Profile

Activities of the candidate in the HackerRank Community (HRC). It includes the candidate's certificate, badges, and contest details. The Public Profile is a part of the Candidate Packet.


Click here to learn more.
Skill Summary

Summary of a candidate's performance in all the skills that are mapped to a particular role in which they are being evaluated.


Click here to learn more.
Timeline

List of events including tests and interviews on HackerRank in which a candidate has participated historically, arranged chronologically, in the order of their occurrence. The timeline is a part of the Candidate Packet.


Click here to learn more.
Verified Skills Skills in which a candidate has successfully completed the HackerRank Skill Certification test.

Term Section  Definition 
Question  General 
A technical problem to evaluate the candidate on a particular skill. Questions can be of different types.

Click here to learn more. 
Library Questions  General  A collection of all the readymade questions created by HackerRank. These questions are of various types and complexities, categorized across multiple programming languages. These questions come under HackerRank Questions in the Library. Library Questions are often referred to as Library content. 
Custom Questions  General  Questions created by you and other members of your company using the HackerRank account. These questions come under the "My Company Questions" section in the library. Custom Questions are often referred to as Library content.
Archived Questions  General  This comprises all the custom questions that are archived by either you or any other member of your company using the HackerRank for Work account.
Cloning a Question  General  Making a copy of a particular question.
Leaked Question  General  A question on the internet matching structurally and semantically with the HackerRank library question. Leaked questions are filtered out in the library by default.

Click here to learn more.
Programming questions General  Questions types such as Coding, HTML<CSS<Javascript, Database, and Approximate Solution are recommended for junior developers.
Projects Questions General Container-based real-world challenges that allow you to evaluate programmers who are familiar with each layer of software technology and are adept at front-end programming, back-end programming, Full-stack development, DevOps, Data Science, and databases.

Click here to learn more.
Question Insights Question Insights These are data points that provide a complete statistical analysis of a question helping the hiring company analyze the performance of that question under multiple parameters.

Click here to learn more.
Author Question Insights The one who created the question.
Attempts Question Insights A number of the candidates submitted a response to the question.
Recommended Time Question Insights Suggested time to solve the question.
Median Score Question Insights 50% of the candidates who attempted the question scored less than or equal to the number mentioned.
Median Attempt Time Question Insights 50% of the candidates who attempted this question took less than or equal to the time mentioned.
Median time To Full Score Question Insights 50% of the candidates who scored 100% answering this question took less than or equal to the time mentioned.
Score Distribution Question Insights A graph that elaborates the distribution of the score percentage of candidates who attempted a response to the question.

Click here to learn more.
Usage Over Time Question Insights A graph that explains how many candidates attempted to answer this question per month from its inception to date.

Click here to learn more.
Candidates by language Question Insights This pie chart shows the percentage of candidates answering this question based on language.
Language Stats Question Insights A statistical table of candidates by language and the Median Score, Maximum Score Attained, and Median Time Taken.

 

Term Definition
Test Usage Dashboard Embedded Looker dashboards that give you deeper insights into the various activities related to Tests that are performed from your HackerRank account. It helps you analyze which of your company's recruitment teams are being efficient and effective with conducting tests and the candidates’ responses to them. The Test Usage Dashboard is present inside the Insights tab of your HackerRank account, and only company admin users can access this dashboard.

Click here to learn more.
Interview Usage Dashboard Embedded Looker dashboards that give you deeper insights into the various activities related to interviews that are performed from your HackerRank account. It helps you analyze which of your company's recruitment teams are efficient and effective in conducting interviews and the duration of interviewing the candidates. The Interview Usage Dashboard is present inside the Insights tab of your HackerRank account, and only company admin users can access this dashboard.

Click here to learn more.
Interview Questions Dashboard Embedded Looker dashboards in your account that display the overall statistics of HackerRank questions and the custom questions that are used in your interviews.

Click here to learn more.
Legacy Reports Set of dashboards and trends to view the activities of the Recruiters and the developers in the form of charts. These are the former representation of insights of your HackerRank account and will be deprecated soon. The improved dashboards are Test Usage Dashboard, Interview Usage Dashboard, and Interview Question Dashboards explained earlier.
title: HackerRank Glossary
